p: The phenolic compounds salvianolic acid B, ferulic acid, apigenin- O-glucoside, eriodictyol-7- O-glucoside, quercetin-7- O-glalactoside, luteolin-7- O-glucoside, and rosmarinic acid (obtained from Extrasynthese, Genay Cedex, France) were used as standards for the phenolic characterization of the aqueous extract. Thymol 99% (Sigma Aldrich, Germany) was also used as a standard reference to confirm the identity of the compound in the essential oil. Glibenclamide (Alfa aesar, Great Britain), acarbose (Bayer Pharma AG, Leverkusen, Germany), and quercetin (Sigma- Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, United States) were used as reference standard for the in vivo antidiabetic activity, in vitro digestive enzyme inhibitory activity, and radical scavenging activity tests of the samples, respectively.
